intro: Mesembryanthemum stenandrum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ice plant, is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a succulent plant characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, often blue or purple flowers. The plant has a shallow root system and is adapted to arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in sandy soils.
